titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Golden Papers, 1911-1970 RL.11001
titlestmt.author: Richard Collier

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-07-29 20:13:54 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History

did.abstract: Graphic artist and Creative Director at CBS Radio and Television divisions. Creator of the CBS "eye" logo and corporate typography.
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48-hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into the following series: Advertising and Design; Advertising; CBS Corporate Files; Personal Files; Publications and printed materials; and Large Format Materials.

eventgrp.event: Graduates from Vocational School for Boys; moves to Los Angeles and works in lithography and photoengraving.
Returns to New York; works for Journal American, House & Garden
U.S. Army; works on training manual design; discharged 1946 with rank of Captain
CBS Television; named Creative Director in 1951
New corporate style for CBS: typography based on Didot typeface; "eye" logo symbol based on imaged from Shaker folk art

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], William Golden Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this finding aid: 2014-0102

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The William Golden Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 2014

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Primarily print advertisements, pamphlets and brochures, corporate publications and other printed materials, personal correspondence, design work and other materials that document Golden's career in advertising and graphic design at CBS Radio and Television. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: A run of the serial publication "CBS Program Book" followed by "CBS Television Clients and Programs" has been removed and cataloged separately.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.
